content.raw:
I'm on board with upstream libraries \(\+ sensors, transport, msgs, common\) providing useful interfaces. I believe gazebo should treat every system as a plugin. A system plugin only has to adhere to a fairly minimal `ign-gazebo` interface. These plugins could load other plugins, if they desire.

There are going to be many types of Systems, including many one-off systems, and we can’t create a concrete interface for each system type. The user is going to tell gazebo what systems to run, and we really do not need to know what a system is for.

I also want to keep this as dead simple as possible. Ignition gazebo can just load the specified system plugins, and it’s up to the author of each plugin to do the right thing.
